page.title: 17ANNUAL EVENTS
page.content: The Repeal of the Red Flag Act in 1894 by Parliament meant that for the first time in British history the motor car was able to legally travel above 5mph. To celebrate the Royal Automobile Club organised arace from Hyde Park Corner, London to Madeira Drive in Brighton- a distance of over 52 miles.This run has now become an annual event 'The Veteran and Vintage Car Ralley',which takes place on the second Sunday in November. In l977 over 500 competitors took to the same route on bicycles participating in a fund raising event for the British Heart Foundation. With an increased popularity of cycling, a fitness 'revolution' and the success of the first event, total numbers of competitors had risen to over 30,000 in l984. That was with numbers of applications limited for safety!
